description: Fans holding Canadian flags cheer before the women's 400-metre individual medley final at the 2024 Summer Olympics in Nanterre, France, on July 29, 2024. (AP Photo/Martin Meissner)Meissner)
title: Canada Wraps up Paris Olympics With Record 27 Medals

description: Foreign Affairs Minister Mélanie Joly rises during question period in the House of Commons on Parliament Hill in Ottawa on June 3, 2024. (The Canadian Press/Spencer Colby)
title: Ottawa Condemns Israeli Bombing for Civilian Casualty as Ambassador Retorts That Terrorists Were Targeted

description: A section of skin tissue, harvested from a lesion on the skin of a monkey, that had been infected with monkeypox virus, is seen at 50X magnification on day four of rash development in 1968. (CDC/Handout via Reuters)
title: WHO Schedules Emergency Meeting Over Mpox Outbreak

description: Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskyy during a visit to Washington on July 10, 2024. (Madalina Vasiliu/The Epoch Times)
title: Zelenskyy Indirectly Confirms Ukraine’s Military Operation in Russia

description: Spectators watch the women s rugby match between France and the United States in the fan zone of the 11th arrondissement town hall installed for the Olympic Games in Paris, France, on July 29, 2024. (Photo by Mathilde Kaczkowski / Hans Lucas / Hans Lucas via AFP) (Photo by MATHILDE KACZKOWSKI/Hans Lucas/AFP via Getty Images)
title: Fans Watch Paris 2024 Closing Ceremony on Large Screen in Central Paris

description: BYD electric cars for export waiting to be loaded on the "BYD Explorer NO.1," a domestically manufactured vessel intended to export Chinese automobiles, at Yantai port, in eastern China's Shandong Province, on Jan. 10, 2024. (STR/AFP via Getty Images)
title: EU ‘Confident’ EV Tariffs in Line With WTO Rules Following Beijing’s Complaint

description: Cars drive slowly through water overflowing on to highway 40 in Sainte-Anne-de-Bellevue on the island of Montreal after heavy rains hit the area on Aug. 9, 2024. (The Canadian Press/Peter McCabe)
title: Thousands of Quebecers Still in the Dark as Utility Restores Power After Storm

description: Olympic rings on the Eiffel Tower, Paris, France, on June 7, 2024. (Dreamstime/TNS)
title: LIVE NOW: Guests Arrive for the 2024 Olympics Closing Ceremony

description: An aerial view of over Scarborough Shoal in the disputed South China Sea on Feb. 15, 2014. (Jam Sta Rosa/AFP via Getty Images)
title: Philippine, Chinese Air Forces Trade Accusations Over Scarborough Shoal

description:
B-Girl Raygun of Team Australia 
competes during the B-Girls Round Robin - Group B on day fourteen of the Olympic Games Paris 2024 at Place de la Concorde on Aug. 9, 2024. (Elsa/Getty Images)
title: Australian Chef de Mission, Breakdancer Respond to Negative Reaction for Olympic Peformance

description: A retiree plays electronic poker machines at the Randwick Labor Club in Sydney, Australia, on Dec. 21, 2012. (William West/AFP via Getty Images)
title: Rising Pressure for a Total Ban on Gambling Advertisements

description: Australian Security Intelligence Organisation (ASIO) Director General Mike Burgess poses for a portrait ahead of his annual threat assessment speech at ASIO headquarters in Canberra, Australia on Feb. 28, 2024. (AAP Image/Mick Tsikas)
title: ‘At Least 3’ Nations Interfering in Australia: ASIO

description: Greens member for Griffith Max Chandler-Mather at a press conference at Parliament House in Canberra, Australia, July 1, 2024. (AAP Image/Mick Tsikas)
title: No Reset for Greens, Labor Deadlock Over Housing Crisis

description: Jasper Mayor Richard Ireland, second left in blue, looks at what is left of his home of 67 years, with (L-R) federal Minister of Emergency Preparedness Harjit Sajjan, Alberta MLA Shane Getson, Alberta Premier Danielle Smith, Alberta Minister of Forestry and Parks Todd Loewen, and Alberta Minister of Public Safety and Emergency Services Mike Ellis in Jasper, on July 26, 2024. (The Canadian Press/Amber Bracken)
title: Jasper’s Mayor Says Date When Evacuees Can Return Home Will Be Announced Monday

description: Australia's Deputy Prime Minister and Defence Minister Richard Marles in Melbourne, Australia, on May 1, 2024. (Asanka Brendon Ratnayake-Pool/Getty Images)
title: Australia, Canada Pledge Efforts to ‘Avoid War’ in Indo-Pacific

description: McGill University is seen Oct. 13, 2023, in Montreal. Researchers at McGill University have published a study showing that outdoor ultrafine particles are linked to the deaths of an estimated 1,100 people per year in Canada’s two biggest cities. (The Canadian Press/Ryan Remiorz)
title: Ultrafine Particles Linked to 1,100 Deaths per Year in Montreal, Toronto: Study

description: Cars drive slowly through water overflowing on to highway 40 in Sainte-Anne-de-Bellevue on the island of Montreal after heavy rains hit the area on August 9, 2024. Quebec is starting to recover after the remnants of Hurricane Debby pummeled several regions of the province with heavy rainfall on Friday, knocking power out and flooding roadways and basements. (The Canadian Press//Peter McCabe)
title: Quebec Recovering From Historic Rainfall, Power Outages as Storm Remnants Move East

description: President of South Africa, Cyril Ramaphosa, speaks in Johannesburg, South Africa, on June 2, 2024. (Chris McGrath/Getty Images)
title: South African Officials Push for Renewal of US Trade Pact

description: The Fairmont Queen Elizabeth Hotel is seen in downtown Montreal, Thursday, July 4, 2024. Workers at Montreal’s Queen Elizabeth hotel are striking for a third straight day in the middle of the busy summer tourist season, but this time they are jointed by picketers from two other hotels in the city, the Marriott Château Champlain and the Hyatt Place Montreal. (The Canadian Press/Christinne Muschi)
title: Hotel Workers in Montreal Picket for Third Day in Protest of Contract Impasse

description: A Canada Border Services Agency patch is seen on an officer’s uniform in Calgary on Aug. 1, 2019. (Jeff Mcintosh/The Canadian Press)
title: Law Allowing Phone, Laptop Search at Borders Unconstitutional, Ontario Court Rules
